meanings.definition: A track or set of tracks made of steel rails along which passenger and freight trains run.
meanings.sent1: The railway near my house is used by many trains every day.
meanings.sent2: I took the railway to visit my grandparents in the next town.
meanings.sent3: The railway seemed to have a mind of its own, always guiding the trains in the right direction.
meanings.sent4: Her life was like a railway, with twists and turns leading her to unexpected destinations.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the railway rumbling in the distance filled me with a sense of adventure.

meanings.definition: A system of transport using trains to carry passengers or goods.
meanings.sent1: The railway is an efficient way to travel long distances.
meanings.sent2: The railway company announced new routes to accommodate more passengers.
meanings.sent3: The railway conductor told a joke to lighten the mood on the crowded train.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a well-oiled railway, always reliable and strong.
meanings.sent5: The railway network connected cities and towns, bringing people closer together.
